title: NYPD Hunts for a Dozen Suspects in Manhattan Assault
sub_head: A 26-year-old man was robbed and beaten in Chinatown midday Friday
body:
New York Police Department detectives are searching for a dozen suspects in a daylight robbery that occurred at a busy intersection in the Manhattan neighborhood of Chinatown, police officials said.
A group of men and women assaulted and robbed a 26-year-old man at 11:30 a.m. Friday after he got off a bus coming from Atlanta, NYPD officials said.
The suspects surrounded the man at the intersection of Canal and Allen streets, according to the officials. The man was beaten and cut with an unknown object, and suffered slashes to his head, torso and hand, the officials said. The suspects then took the man’s clothes and cell phone before fleeing in private vehicles, the officials said.
The victim, who is from Brooklyn, was transported to Manhattan’s Bellevue Hospital, where he was in stable condition.
A NYPD spokeswoman said Monday that investigators were still working to determine the motive of the suspects. The NYPD circulated a video of the incident over the weekend in an effort to identify the suspects.
